purpose: This code appears to gather system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses -> Buffer.from() -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded domain names that appear to be part of a security testing or monitoring service
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Use of 'rejectUnauthorized: false' in HTTP requests which disables SSL certificate verification
Insecure data exfiltration through HTTP GET requests
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information such as MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then attempts to send this information to multiple external domains using HTTP requests. The presence of hardcoded domain names associated with security testing services (oast-cn.byted-dast.com, oast-row.byted-dast.com, oast.fun) suggests this may be part of a monitoring or telemetry system. Additionally, the code disables SSL certificate verification which makes it vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. The fact that this information is being sent over unencrypted HTTP channels raises significant privacy and security concerns.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of potentially malicious behavior by collecting system information and sending it to external servers without clear user consent. It uses insecure communication methods and appears to be designed for data exfiltration or monitoring purposes.
